name: Ardbeg 10 Year Old
about: One of the peatiest whiskies in the world, Ardbeg 10 delivers intense smoke balanced with surprising sweetness and complexity.
tastingNotes: Intense peat smoke, tar, espresso, lemon zest, black pepper, hints of vanilla and toffee
history: Ardbeg distillery dates to 1815 and nearly closed in the 1980s before being revived by Glenmorangie.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a few drops of water to open up the sweetness. Serve at room temperature.
description: One of the peatiest whiskies in the world, Ardbeg 10 delivers intense smoke balanced with surprising sweetness and complexity.

name: Laphroaig 10 Year Old
about: Famous for its medicinal, iodine character, Laphroaig divides opinion but has a devoted following including the Prince of Wales.
tastingNotes: Seaweed, iodine, medicinal peat, smoke, salt, hint of sweetness underneath
history: Founded in 1815, Laphroaig has held a Royal Warrant since 1994. The only Scotch whisky to carry this honor.
servingRecommendation: Best neat. Water can help tame the intensity for newcomers.
description: Famous for its medicinal, iodine character, Laphroaig divides opinion but has a devoted following including the Prince of Wales.

name: Lagavulin 16 Year Old
about: The quintessential Islay malt, Lagavulin 16 balances intense peat with rich sherry cask influence.
tastingNotes: Peat smoke, dried fruit, sea salt, wood smoke, sherry sweetness, long finish
history: Established in 1816, Lagavulin sits next to the ruins of Dunyvaig Castle. It's been called 'the definitive Islay malt.'
servingRecommendation: Neat at room temperature. A drop of water reveals hidden sweetness.
description: The quintessential Islay malt, Lagavulin 16 balances intense peat with rich sherry cask influence.

name: Bruichladdich Port Charlotte 10
about: Bruichladdich's heavily peated expression, named after the nearby village. Robust and maritime.
tastingNotes: Bonfire smoke, tar, vanilla, honey, black pepper, maritime salt
history: Port Charlotte represents Bruichladdich's heavily peated range, reviving the style of a lost Islay distillery.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a splash of water to tame the high ABV.
description: Bruichladdich's heavily peated expression, named after the nearby village. Robust and maritime.

name: Caol Ila 12 Year Old
about: The most produced Islay malt, Caol Ila offers a lighter, more approachable peat profile with citrus notes.
tastingNotes: Light peat, lemon oil, green apple, olive brine, gentle smoke, malty sweetness
history: Built in 1846, Caol Ila (Gaelic for 'Sound of Islay') overlooks the strait between Islay and Jura.
servingRecommendation: Excellent neat or in a highball with soda water.
description: The most produced Islay malt, Caol Ila offers a lighter, more approachable peat profile with citrus notes.

name: Bowmore 15 Year Old
about: One of the oldest distilleries in Scotland, Bowmore offers a balanced, medium-peated style with sherry influence.
tastingNotes: Heather honey, dark chocolate, peat smoke, dried fruit, sea salt, oak spice
history: Founded in 1779, Bowmore is the oldest licensed distillery on Islay and maintains its own floor maltings.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a few drops of water.
description: One of the oldest distilleries in Scotland, Bowmore offers a balanced, medium-peated style with sherry influence.

name: The Macallan 18 Year Old Sherry Oak
about: The benchmark for sherry-matured Scotch, Macallan 18 is rich, complex, and highly sought after.
tastingNotes: Dried fruit, orange peel, ginger, wood spice, chocolate, oak, long sherry finish
history: The Macallan has been distilling since 1824 and is known for its exceptional sherry cask program sourced from Spain.
servingRecommendation: Neat at room temperature to fully appreciate the sherry influence.
description: The benchmark for sherry-matured Scotch, Macallan 18 is rich, complex, and highly sought after.

name: The Macallan 12 Year Old Double Cask
about: A marriage of American and European sherry-seasoned oak casks, creating a balanced, honeyed whisky.
tastingNotes: Honey, citrus, vanilla, dried fruit, subtle oak spice, creamy texture
history: Double Cask was introduced in 2016 and has become one of Macallan's most popular expressions.
servingRecommendation: Neat or on the rocks. Versatile enough for cocktails.
description: A marriage of American and European sherry-seasoned oak casks, creating a balanced, honeyed whisky.

name: Glenfiddich 18 Year Old
about: Matured in Oloroso sherry and bourbon casks, Glenfiddich 18 is fruity, rich, and elegant.
tastingNotes: Baked apple, oak, dried fruit, robust oak, hints of toasted almonds
history: Glenfiddich was founded in 1887 and pioneered single malt marketing, becoming the world's best-selling single malt.
servingRecommendation: Best enjoyed neat to appreciate the balance of fruit and oak.
description: Matured in Oloroso sherry and bourbon casks, Glenfiddich 18 is fruity, rich, and elegant.

name: Glenfiddich 21 Year Old Reserva Rum Cask Finish
about: Finished in Caribbean rum casks, this unique expression adds tropical sweetness to classic Speyside character.
tastingNotes: Banana, toffee, lime zest, ginger, vanilla, brown sugar, fig
history: First released in 2002, the Gran Reserva pioneered rum cask finishing in Scotch whisky.
servingRecommendation: Neat, or in tropical-inspired cocktails.
description: Finished in Caribbean rum casks, this unique expression adds tropical sweetness to classic Speyside character.

name: The Glenlivet 18 Year Old
about: A classic Speyside expression with elegant fruit and floral notes, matured in first and second fill American oak.
tastingNotes: Orange blossom, toffee apple, spice, dried fruit, elegant oak
history: The Glenlivet was the first licensed distillery in the Speyside region (1824) and set the standard for the region's style.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a small splash of water.
description: A classic Speyside expression with elegant fruit and floral notes, matured in first and second fill American oak.

name: Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask
about: Finished in rum casks from the Caribbean, creating a uniquely sweet and tropical Speyside malt.
tastingNotes: Toffee, vanilla, tropical fruit, butterscotch, sweet oak, golden syrup
history: Balvenie is unique for maintaining traditional floor maltings and its own cooperage.
servingRecommendation: Neat. The sweetness makes it an excellent dessert whisky.
description: Finished in rum casks from the Caribbean, creating a uniquely sweet and tropical Speyside malt.

name: Balvenie 12 Year Old DoubleWood
about: Matured in bourbon and finished in sherry casks, DoubleWood is honeyed, smooth, and approachable.
tastingNotes: Honey, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, sherry sweetness, dried fruit
history: DoubleWood, launched in 1993, pioneered the 'wood finishing' technique now common in Scotch.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a drop of water.
description: Matured in bourbon and finished in sherry casks, DoubleWood is honeyed, smooth, and approachable.

name: Aberlour A'Bunadh
about: Cask strength, sherry-bomb whisky matured exclusively in Oloroso sherry butts. Intense and rich.
tastingNotes: Dark chocolate, Christmas cake, orange peel, spice, dried fruit, powerful sherry
history: A'Bunadh (Gaelic for 'original') was launched in 1998 as an homage to the distillery's 19th-century style.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with water to tame the cask strength. Opens up beautifully.
description: Cask strength, sherry-bomb whisky matured exclusively in Oloroso sherry butts. Intense and rich.

name: GlenDronach 18 Year Old Allardice
about: Named after the distillery's founder, this is a masterclass in Oloroso sherry cask maturation.
tastingNotes: Dried fruit, dark chocolate, leather, oak spice, sherry, walnut
history: GlenDronach was founded in 1826 and is renowned for its traditional sherry cask maturation program.
servingRecommendation: Neat at room temperature.
description: Named after the distillery's founder, this is a masterclass in Oloroso sherry cask maturation.

name: Oban 14 Year Old
about: A West Highland malt bridging the styles of Highlands and Islands, with maritime and fruity character.
tastingNotes: Sea salt, honey, orange peel, light smoke, dried fruit, oak
history: One of the oldest distilleries in Scotland (1794), Oban's cramped town-center location limits production.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a splash of water.
description: A West Highland malt bridging the styles of Highlands and Islands, with maritime and fruity character.

name: Dalmore 18 Year Old
about: Rich and opulent, Dalmore 18 showcases exceptional sherry cask influence and chocolate notes.
tastingNotes: Dark chocolate, orange marmalade, coffee, dried fruit, spice, vanilla
history: Founded in 1839, Dalmore is known for its stag emblem and exceptional sherry cask program.
servingRecommendation: Neat to appreciate the complex sherry influence.
description: Rich and opulent, Dalmore 18 showcases exceptional sherry cask influence and chocolate notes.

name: Glenmorangie 18 Year Old
about: Elegant and refined, matured in the tallest stills in Scotland producing a delicate, floral spirit.
tastingNotes: Dried flowers, raisins, honey, oak, hints of dark chocolate, elegant finish
history: Glenmorangie has used the same tall stills since 1843, creating an exceptionally pure spirit.
servingRecommendation: Neat, slightly below room temperature.
description: Elegant and refined, matured in the tallest stills in Scotland producing a delicate, floral spirit.

name: Highland Park 18 Year Old Viking Pride
about: From Orkney's windswept islands, Highland Park balances heathery peat with sherry sweetness.
tastingNotes: Heather honey, aromatic smoke, dried fruit, dark chocolate, spice, maritime
history: Founded in 1798, Highland Park maintains traditional floor maltings using Orkney peat.
servingRecommendation: Neat at room temperature.
description: From Orkney's windswept islands, Highland Park balances heathery peat with sherry sweetness.

name: Clynelish 14 Year Old
about: A cult favorite among whisky enthusiasts, known for its distinctive waxy, coastal character.
tastingNotes: Candle wax, tropical fruit, sea spray, honey, subtle smoke, citrus
history: Built in 1967 adjacent to the original Brora distillery, Clynelish is prized by whisky connoisseurs.
servingRecommendation: Neat to appreciate the waxy texture.
description: A cult favorite among whisky enthusiasts, known for its distinctive waxy, coastal character.

name: Auchentoshan Three Wood
about: Triple distilled Lowland malt matured in bourbon, Oloroso, and Pedro Ximénez sherry casks.
tastingNotes: Toffee, butterscotch, dark fruit, hazelnut, orange, sherry sweetness
history: The only Scottish distillery to triple distill all its whisky, creating a lighter, smoother style.
servingRecommendation: Neat or on the rocks.
description: Triple distilled Lowland malt matured in bourbon, Oloroso, and Pedro Ximénez sherry casks.

name: Springbank 15 Year Old
about: From the last family-owned distillery in Campbeltown, Springbank 15 is complex and maritime.
tastingNotes: Sea salt, vanilla, peat smoke, sherry fruit, leather, oak spice
history: Springbank has been family-owned since 1828, maintaining complete in-house production from barley to bottle.
servingRecommendation: Neat at room temperature.
description: From the last family-owned distillery in Campbeltown, Springbank 15 is complex and maritime.

name: Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve 15 Year
about: The most sought-after bourbon in the world, Pappy 15 offers exceptional depth and smoothness.
tastingNotes: Caramel, vanilla, oak, cherry, leather, tobacco, long smooth finish
history: Julian 'Pappy' Van Winkle Sr. started his bourbon career in 1893. The modern legend was born in the 1990s.
servingRecommendation: Neat at room temperature. Adding anything would be sacrilege to most fans.
description: The most sought-after bourbon in the world, Pappy 15 offers exceptional depth and smoothness.

name: Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve 20 Year
about: Even rarer than the 15-year, this bourbon pushes the boundaries of oak aging without becoming over-oaked.
tastingNotes: Deep caramel, leather, tobacco, dark fruit, vanilla, complex oak
history: 20 years in Kentucky's climate is extraordinary for bourbon, resulting in exceptional complexity.
servingRecommendation: Neat only.
description: Even rarer than the 15-year, this bourbon pushes the boundaries of oak aging without becoming over-oaked.

name: Buffalo Trace
about: The flagship bourbon from the distillery that makes Pappy, an exceptional value at its price point.
tastingNotes: Caramel, vanilla, brown sugar, mint, oak, hint of dark fruit
history: Buffalo Trace distillery has been making whiskey on the same site since 1775, surviving prohibition as a 'medicinal' producer.
servingRecommendation: Neat, on the rocks, or in classic cocktails like an Old Fashioned.
description: The flagship bourbon from the distillery that makes Pappy, an exceptional value at its price point.

name: Blanton's Original Single Barrel
about: The first commercially marketed single barrel bourbon, each bottle comes from one exceptional cask.
tastingNotes: Citrus, honey, vanilla, caramel, hint of spice, smooth finish
history: Named after Colonel Albert B. Blanton, who introduced single barrel selection at Buffalo Trace in the 1980s.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a single large ice cube.
description: The first commercially marketed single barrel bourbon, each bottle comes from one exceptional cask.

name: Woodford Reserve
about: Craft bourbon from one of Kentucky's most beautiful distilleries, known for its rich, balanced profile.
tastingNotes: Dried fruit, vanilla, tobacco, chocolate, orange peel, spice
history: The Woodford Reserve Distillery has been making whiskey since 1812 on the site of Elijah Pepper's distillery.
servingRecommendation: Neat, or makes an excellent Old Fashioned or Manhattan.
description: Craft bourbon from one of Kentucky's most beautiful distilleries, known for its rich, balanced profile.

name: Maker's Mark
about: A wheated bourbon known for its soft, approachable character and iconic hand-dipped red wax seal.
tastingNotes: Caramel, vanilla, wheat bread, honey, orange, gentle spice
history: Bill Samuels Sr. created Maker's Mark in 1953 using soft red winter wheat instead of rye for a gentler flavor.
servingRecommendation: Very versatile - neat, rocks, or cocktails. Great for Mint Juleps.
description: A wheated bourbon known for its soft, approachable character and iconic hand-dipped red wax seal.

name: Maker's Mark Cask Strength
about: Full-proof version of the classic wheated bourbon, intense but retaining the signature smoothness.
tastingNotes: Intense caramel, baking spices, vanilla, oak char, brown sugar, long warm finish
history: Released in 2014, Cask Strength brings the barrel-proof experience while maintaining Maker's soft wheated character.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a few drops of water to open it up.
description: Full-proof version of the classic wheated bourbon, intense but retaining the signature smoothness.

name: Wild Turkey 101
about: A bold, spicy bourbon that has remained unchanged for decades. The bartender's choice.
tastingNotes: Vanilla, caramel, rye spice, tobacco, charred oak, bold and spicy
history: Master Distiller Jimmy Russell has been crafting Wild Turkey since 1954, maintaining its bold character.
servingRecommendation: Great neat, on rocks, or in cocktails. Perfect for an Old Fashioned.
description: A bold, spicy bourbon that has remained unchanged for decades. The bartender's choice.

name: Wild Turkey Rare Breed
about: Barrel-proof small batch bourbon blending 6, 8, and 12-year old stocks for maximum complexity.
tastingNotes: Intense vanilla, dark caramel, tobacco, leather, baking spices, powerful oak
history: Rare Breed was introduced in 1991 as a barrel-proof expression showcasing the depth of Wild Turkey's warehouses.
servingRecommendation: Neat with optional water. Too good to mix.
description: Barrel-proof small batch bourbon blending 6, 8, and 12-year old stocks for maximum complexity.

name: Four Roses Single Barrel
about: Each bottle represents one of Four Roses' ten distinct bourbon recipes, selected for excellence.
tastingNotes: Ripe plum, cherry, spice, vanilla, oak, maple syrup
history: Four Roses uses two mashbills and five yeast strains to create ten distinct recipes, each numbered and tracked.
servingRecommendation: Neat to appreciate the unique single barrel character.
description: Each bottle represents one of Four Roses' ten distinct bourbon recipes, selected for excellence.

name: Elijah Craig Small Batch
about: Named after the Baptist minister credited with charring the first bourbon barrels, rich and oaky.
tastingNotes: Vanilla, caramel, charred oak, spice, dark fruit, smoke
history: Heaven Hill created Elijah Craig in 1986, naming it after the legendary Kentucky distiller and minister.
servingRecommendation: Neat, rocks, or in an Old Fashioned.
description: Named after the Baptist minister credited with charring the first bourbon barrels, rich and oaky.

name: Elijah Craig Barrel Proof
about: Uncut and unfiltered, one of the best values in barrel-proof bourbon with exceptional complexity.
tastingNotes: Intense caramel, dark chocolate, leather, char, vanilla, powerful oak
history: Barrel Proof was introduced in 2012 and has won numerous awards for its exceptional quality-to-price ratio.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a splash of water. Each batch is slightly different.
description: Uncut and unfiltered, one of the best values in barrel-proof bourbon with exceptional complexity.

name: Angel's Envy
about: Finished in port wine casks, creating a uniquely fruity and smooth bourbon experience.

specifications.caskType: New American Oak + Port Cask Finish

tastingNotes: Dark fruit, vanilla, maple, cherry, port wine sweetness, gentle oak
history: Created by Lincoln Henderson (former Woodford Reserve Master Distiller) and his son in 2010.
servingRecommendation: Neat to appreciate the port influence.
description: Finished in port wine casks, creating a uniquely fruity and smooth bourbon experience.

name: Booker's Bourbon
about: Uncut and unfiltered small batch bourbon created by legendary Beam distiller Booker Noe.
tastingNotes: Vanilla, peanut, oak, caramel, tobacco, intense and powerful
history: Booker Noe created this bourbon to share with friends, bottled straight from the barrel without dilution.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with water. Named batches released quarterly.
description: Uncut and unfiltered small batch bourbon created by legendary Beam distiller Booker Noe.

name: Knob Creek 9 Year
about: Pre-Prohibition style bourbon aged longer than typical for a full-flavored, robust experience.
tastingNotes: Maple, toasted nuts, vanilla, oak, caramel, rich and chewy
history: Part of Jim Beam's Small Batch Collection, Knob Creek revives the rich, full-bodied pre-Prohibition style.
servingRecommendation: Neat or on the rocks. Robust enough for cocktails.
description: Pre-Prohibition style bourbon aged longer than typical for a full-flavored, robust experience.

name: WhistlePig 10 Year
about: 100% rye whiskey aged in new American oak, leading the American rye renaissance.
tastingNotes: Allspice, clove, mint, caramel, vanilla, rye bread, bold spice
history: Founded in 2010 on a Vermont farm, WhistlePig helped revive American rye whiskey's prestige.
servingRecommendation: Neat or in a classic Manhattan.
description: 100% rye whiskey aged in new American oak, leading the American rye renaissance.

name: WhistlePig 15 Year Estate Oak
about: Finished in Vermont estate oak barrels made from trees on the distillery farm.
tastingNotes: Caramel, maple, baking spices, orange peel, honey, elegant oak
history: The Estate Oak is made from Vermont White Oak harvested from the WhistlePig farm in Shoreham.
servingRecommendation: Neat to appreciate the unique Vermont oak character.
description: Finished in Vermont estate oak barrels made from trees on the distillery farm.

name: Sazerac Rye
about: The official whiskey of the Sazerac cocktail, spicy and complex with excellent value.
tastingNotes: Clove, vanilla, pepper, anise, rye spice, caramel, crisp finish
history: Named after the famous New Orleans cocktail created in the 1850s at the Sazerac Coffee House.
servingRecommendation: Essential in a Sazerac cocktail or excellent neat.
description: The official whiskey of the Sazerac cocktail, spicy and complex with excellent value.

name: Rittenhouse Rye Bottled in Bond
about: A bartender favorite, this bottled-in-bond rye delivers spice and value.
tastingNotes: Rye spice, cherry, oak, pepper, toffee, dry finish
history: Named after Philadelphia's Rittenhouse Square, home to many 19th-century rye distilleries.
servingRecommendation: The go-to rye for Manhattans and whiskey sours.
description: A bartender favorite, this bottled-in-bond rye delivers spice and value.

name: High West Double Rye
about: A blend of two ryes - a spicy younger MGP rye and a mellower older rye.
tastingNotes: Mint, clove, cinnamon, licorice, honey, rye spice
history: High West in Park City was Utah's first distillery since Prohibition and pioneered rye blending.
servingRecommendation: Excellent neat or in classic rye cocktails.
description: A blend of two ryes - a spicy younger MGP rye and a mellower older rye.

name: Yamazaki 18 Year Old
about: Japan's most prestigious whisky from the country's first malt distillery, awarded World's Best Whisky.
tastingNotes: Dried fruit, dark chocolate, sandalwood, incense, honey, Mizunara oak
history: Yamazaki was founded by Shinjiro Torii in 1923, making it Japan's first commercial whisky distillery.
servingRecommendation: Neat at room temperature to appreciate the Mizunara influence.
description: Japan's most prestigious whisky from the country's first malt distillery, awarded World's Best Whisky.

name: Yamazaki 12 Year Old
about: The flagship expression of Japan's oldest distillery, elegant and fruity.
tastingNotes: Peach, pineapple, vanilla, coconut, hint of Mizunara spice
history: Yamazaki 12 introduced the world to Japanese single malts and remains the benchmark.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a few drops of water. Excellent in a highball.
description: The flagship expression of Japan's oldest distillery, elegant and fruity.

name: Hakushu 12 Year Old
about: From Japan's forest distillery, Hakushu is fresh, green, and subtly smoky.
tastingNotes: Fresh mint, cucumber, green apple, light smoke, citrus, herbaceous
history: Built in 1973 in the Japanese Alps, Hakushu is known as the 'mountain forest' distillery.
servingRecommendation: Excellent in a highball with soda water. Also great neat.
description: From Japan's forest distillery, Hakushu is fresh, green, and subtly smoky.

name: Hibiki 21 Year Old
about: The pinnacle of Japanese blending, combining Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita whiskies.
tastingNotes: Rose, Mizunara oak, dried fruit, sandalwood, honey, extraordinarily complex
history: Hibiki means 'harmony' and represents Suntory's art of blending at its highest level.
servingRecommendation: Neat only. Treat with reverence.
description: The pinnacle of Japanese blending, combining Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita whiskies.

name: Hibiki Japanese Harmony
about: Accessible entry to Hibiki, blending malt and grain whiskies in perfect harmony.
tastingNotes: Orange peel, honey, white chocolate, sandalwood, subtle oak
history: Japanese Harmony was introduced in 2015 to meet global demand while aged stocks rebuild.
servingRecommendation: Neat, on the rocks, or in a highball.
description: Accessible entry to Hibiki, blending malt and grain whiskies in perfect harmony.

name: Nikka From The Barrel
about: A cult favorite, bottled at cask strength and blending Yoichi and Miyagikyo malts.
tastingNotes: Apple, spice, caramel, oak, hint of peat, powerful but balanced
history: Created in 1985, From The Barrel has won numerous international awards for its quality and value.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with water. Also excellent in a highball.
description: A cult favorite, bottled at cask strength and blending Yoichi and Miyagikyo malts.

name: Nikka Coffey Grain
about: Corn-based whisky made in traditional Coffey stills, sweet and bourbon-like.
tastingNotes: Vanilla, cream, corn sweetness, citrus, tropical fruit, smooth
history: Nikka's Coffey stills date to 1963 and were imported from Scotland, producing unique grain whisky.
servingRecommendation: Neat or in cocktails. Excellent in a whisky sour.
description: Corn-based whisky made in traditional Coffey stills, sweet and bourbon-like.

name: Nikka Yoichi Single Malt
about: From Japan's northernmost distillery, Yoichi has a bold, peaty character unusual for Japanese whisky.
tastingNotes: Peat smoke, brine, orchard fruit, malt, maritime, complex
history: Founded by Masataka Taketsuru in 1934, who chose Hokkaido for its climate similarity to Scotland.
servingRecommendation: Neat to appreciate the smoky character.
description: From Japan's northernmost distillery, Yoichi has a bold, peaty character unusual for Japanese whisky.

name: Redbreast 12 Year Old
about: The definitive single pot still Irish whiskey, combining malted and unmalted barley for unique complexity.
tastingNotes: Sherry, dried fruit, toasted wood, spice, pot still creaminess, long finish
history: Redbreast dates to 1903 and represents the pure pot still style that once defined Irish whiskey.
servingRecommendation: Neat at room temperature.
description: The definitive single pot still Irish whiskey, combining malted and unmalted barley for unique complexity.

name: Redbreast 15 Year Old
about: Extra aging adds depth and sophistication to the classic Redbreast pot still character.
tastingNotes: Rich fruit, berries, cream, spice, oak, complex and layered
history: Redbreast 15 was released in 2005, filling the gap between the 12 and the legendary 21 year old.
servingRecommendation: Neat to appreciate the extra complexity.
description: Extra aging adds depth and sophistication to the classic Redbreast pot still character.

name: Green Spot
about: Named after the dot system once used by Dublin bonding houses, a lighter pot still style.
tastingNotes: Fresh orchard fruit, barley, honey, clove, light spice, crisp
history: Green Spot was created for Mitchell & Son in Dublin over 100 years ago. Only 'Spot' whiskey to survive.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with a small splash of water.
description: Named after the dot system once used by Dublin bonding houses, a lighter pot still style.

name: Yellow Spot 12 Year Old
about: Green Spot's older sibling, with additional sherry and Malaga wine cask influence.
tastingNotes: Honey, apricot, toasted wood, ginger, nutmeg, pot still oils
history: Yellow Spot was revived in 2012 after decades of absence, named for the historic bonding system.
servingRecommendation: Neat at room temperature.
description: Green Spot's older sibling, with additional sherry and Malaga wine cask influence.

name: Jameson 18 Year Old
about: The premium expression of Ireland's most famous whiskey, aged in two types of casks.
tastingNotes: Toffee, sherry, leather, wood spice, vanilla, marzipan
history: John Jameson founded his distillery in 1780. Jameson is now the world's best-selling Irish whiskey.
servingRecommendation: Neat to appreciate the age and complexity.
description: The premium expression of Ireland's most famous whiskey, aged in two types of casks.

name: Midleton Very Rare
about: Ireland's most prestigious whiskey, hand-selected annually by the Master Distiller.
tastingNotes: Honey, vanilla, leather, subtle spice, silky texture, exceptional balance
history: Launched in 1984, each year's Midleton Very Rare is a unique blend, never to be repeated.
servingRecommendation: Neat, savored slowly.
description: Ireland's most prestigious whiskey, hand-selected annually by the Master Distiller.

name: Connemara Peated Single Malt
about: The only peated Irish single malt, reviving a style that predates Scotch whisky.
tastingNotes: Peat smoke, heather honey, green fruit, malt, earthy, unique
history: Connemara was launched in 1996 from Cooley Distillery, Ireland's first new distillery in over a century.
servingRecommendation: Neat or with water to explore the smoke.
description: The only peated Irish single malt, reviving a style that predates Scotch whisky.

name: Crown Royal
about: Created in 1939 for the royal visit of King George VI, Canada's most famous whisky.
tastingNotes: Vanilla, maple, light fruit, oak, smooth and easy-drinking
history: Crown Royal was created to commemorate the first visit of a reigning monarch to Canada.
servingRecommendation: On the rocks or in cocktails. Very mixable.
description: Created in 1939 for the royal visit of King George VI, Canada's most famous whisky.

name: Canadian Club 12 Year Old
about: Classic Canadian whisky with extra aging for smoothness and complexity.
tastingNotes: Caramel, vanilla, fruit, subtle spice, rye notes, clean finish
history: Founded in 1858, Canadian Club was once Al Capone's whisky of choice during Prohibition.
servingRecommendation: On the rocks or in a highball with ginger ale.
description: Classic Canadian whisky with extra aging for smoothness and complexity.

name: Lot No. 40
about: 100% rye whisky, one of Canada's finest and most awarded rye expressions.
tastingNotes: Rye spice, clove, pepper, toffee, vanilla, dill, bold and complex
history: Named after the plot of land where the Windham distillery once stood, reviving Canadian rye tradition.
servingRecommendation: Neat or in classic rye cocktails.
description: 100% rye whisky, one of Canada's finest and most awarded rye expressions.

name: Pike Creek 10 Year Old
about: Finished in rum barrels, adding Caribbean sweetness to Canadian smoothness.
tastingNotes: Vanilla, caramel, tropical fruit, rum sweetness, smooth oak
history: Pike Creek represents Canadian innovation, borrowing the rum cask finishing technique.
servingRecommendation: Neat or on the rocks.
description: Finished in rum barrels, adding Caribbean sweetness to Canadian smoothness.
